tweet:
Yesterday at the @OversightDems hearing, Cohen told me that the President lied under oath about his relationship with Felix Sater—which appears to have been a close one.

I look forward to my colleagues serving on the Intelligence Committee getting closer to the truth. https://twitter.com/MSNBC/status/1101250066990460929 …

Last week I signed onto a letter calling on Trump to push the Vietnamese govt to release Michael Nguyen, a US citizen imprisoned without charges for over 7 months. I'm outraged by human rights abuses in Vietnam, and I stand with OC's Vietnamese Americans. https://www.ocregister.com/2019/02/26/demonstrators-in-o-c-s-little-saigon-call-on-trump-to-address-human-rights-issues-in-vietnam/ …

This month, the extreme weather in OC caused $13 million in property damage. The OC BOS has declared an emergency. Climate change has arrived in CA--that's why I introduced the Coastal Communities Adaptation Act. We can't wait any longer to #ActOnClimate https://www.ocregister.com/2019/02/26/recent-rain-total-in-o-c-13-million-supervisors-declare-emergency/ …

The @Surfrider Foundation protects our beaches--an essential element of our coastal community in #CA48. We spoke today about the effects of proposed offshore drilling. The Dept. of the Interior doesn't get to open our shores to special interests at the expense of residents. pic.twitter.com/SFOJ4G3Roo
Last night I talked to @donlemon about the revelation that Donald Trump lied under oath about his relationship with Felix Sater at the @OversightDems hearing. pic.twitter.com/pNc29fk6Gk

Gun violence shouldn't be partisan. More than 90% of Americans support universal background checks--thousands of Americans die every year by gun violence. I'm a proud cosponsor of HR8, which just became the first major gun reform bill to pass the House in decades. #EndGunViolence

Today Michael Cohen told me that convicted Russian mobster Felix Sater occupied an office on Trump's floor, the same one Cohen himself later moved into. 
I asked: Based on those facts, isn’t it true that Donald Trump misled at best, or at worst lied under oath?
Michael Cohen: Yes pic.twitter.com/5ayhTVjM3c

Congress doesn’t block for the President. We serve the American people. 

Why have my Republican colleagues failed to ask even one question about Trump’s activities? If we seek the truth, what are they afraid we’ll find?

This committee’s job is oversight, time to clock in.

The White House isn’t just separating familes at the border– their policy of mass deportation is tearing Vietnamese American families in California. I stand with my Southeast Asian constituents and @CAPAC colleagues against these callous deportations pic.twitter.com/vjE6nq45CS

Today those of us on @OversightDems will have a chance to look the Michael Cohen in the eye and get closer to the facts of what the President knows and when he knew it. Let’s not waste a minute of it on partisan grandstanding, and deliver the truth the American people are seeking

After 250 years of fighting for the right to vote, our democratic rights are still under threat. It's time to #RestoretheVOTE: I am cosponsoring the Voting Rights Advancement Act, which restores the protections and enforcement of the Voting Rights Act to its former strength. pic.twitter.com/CVzX4eBoUE
At today's @TransportDems hearing, we asked experts how we can overhaul our energy infrastructure to battle climate change. pic.twitter.com/6j8sp5U3qT

In CA, climate change has already arrived. If we take a serious approach to infrastructure, we can both reduce carbon emissions, and make our district more resilient to the consequences of climate change. I’m glad @transportdems are holding a hearing on that very idea today. pic.twitter.com/RlwaE3Vmf5

Nearly a year after Trump’s DHS began separating children from their parents at the border, we still don’t know the extent of the practice or the lasting damage it wrought. Today I voted with @oversightdems to subpoena the administration for those answers. pic.twitter.com/JtEIqamaxT
Thanks for having me, OC. Heading back to DC to work for the constituents of #CA48! pic.twitter.com/sBwEtSo0ex

This national emergency declaration was an unlawful dodge of checks and balances. It will rob Californians of disaster relief funds for real emergencies. Today the House will pass a privileged resolution blocking the declaration. I urge Senators with common sense to do the same.
My reflections on Tuesday’s town hall, in the @ocregister this morning: https://www.ocregister.com/2019/02/24/addressing-local-and-global-challenges/ …

Today I introduced the Coastal Communities Adaptation Act. We need to address the reality of climate change if we want to keep the same quality of life when oceans rise. My constituents in #CA48 deserve action. With the Trump Admin ignoring this crisis, it's up to Congress to act pic.twitter.com/PDiYHVOLkJ
Today I joined CNN with @ErinBurnett to talk about the coming Oversight Hearing with testimony from Michael Cohen pic.twitter.com/CSlJgdxTum

The I-405 widening project is the largest transportation project in CA, and it’s right in the heart of #CA48. Thank you to the @goOCTA for briefing me on this project—I’ll be an advocate on @TransportDems for more federal funds to bring OC’s infrastructure into the 21st Century. pic.twitter.com/KVGmr3Zf6z
Joining @RepKatiePorter and @RepGilCisneros now in a panel discussion on serving Orange County in Congress, at the OC Forum. pic.twitter.com/wX0nQH8yNg

It was a pleasure to tour @OCWDWaterNews and learn more about their efforts to create a sustainable water supply. I’m committed to including access to clean water for Orange County in any bipartisan infrastructure package. pic.twitter.com/tzaEbT31gu

I also had a chance today to tour CA48’s biggest employer, @Hyundai, and take questions from employees. I love their commitment to Orange County and to giving back to our community. pic.twitter.com/dxWGAWceZA

In case you missed my first town hall last night—

And yes, I do intend to fight like hell to make sure the federal government works for California. https://www.google.com/amp/s/www.latimes.com/socal/daily-pilot/news/tn-dpt-me-rouda-townhall-20190220-story.html%3foutputType=amp …

We brought healthcare stakeholders across OC together to map out a future in healthcare where everyone is covered, by:
-Opening up Medicare to everyone
-Allowing Medicare to negotiate drug prices
-Reinstating the individual mandate
-Utilizing innovation and supporting research pic.twitter.com/u3JPJKXOlK

POTUS will convene a committee to study whether climate change is a national security threat.

But he’s appointing a climate skeptic to head it up.

We already know it’s the biggest national security threat, full stop. This isn’t a joke for California. https://www.washingtonpost.com/national/health-science/white-house-readies-panel-to-assess-if-climate-change-poses-a-national-security-threat/2019/02/19/ccc8b29e-3396-11e9-af5b-b51b7ff322e9_story.html …

Packed conference room today– we convened a group of community leaders, from activists to business leaders, to talk about how we can fight climate change right here in Orange County. pic.twitter.com/Azs7MukGfz
Thanks for meeting with me, #CA48! #RoudaTownHall pic.twitter.com/MnXefnXxCB

I spoke to @AlexWitt on MSNBC this weekend about Trump's national emergency declaration– it’s an assault on the constitution. When it comes to our founding principles, both houses of Congress need to walk the walk and block this declaration. pic.twitter.com/G1qyYGh3gC

Chaos and dysfunction cannot be allowed to govern our national security. Nuclear proliferation mistakes cannot be undone.

It's time for the White House to get serious about our security, and that means we need to shed sunshine on their relationship with Saudi Arabia. https://twitter.com/RepHarley/status/1097891727128444928 …

Our @oversightdems report reveals that White House advisors including Michael Flynn & Jared Kushner were & possibly still are working to rush highly sensitive nuclear technology to Saudi Arabia, and some stood to personally make money off new power plants.

We will investigate.

Presidents Day is a reminder of the giants of American history who have occupied our seats in Congress—like Lincoln, Kennedy, Bush Sr. 

They knew these seats don’t belong to us, they’re a position of public trust. Let’s live up to their examples and make our time here matter.

In some cases those we lost will make headlines, though others will be laid to rest in anonymity. But all will have had someone who loved and needed them. 

May those of us who have the power to alter our deadly course have the courage to use it. https://twitter.com/RepHarley/status/1096579818236379137 …

It’s easy to become numb to the deadly gun violence which has come to grip our country, but we cannot repeat often enough both our love & commitment towards the survivors, nor our anger and disgust that, should we choose the easy path of inaction, tens of thousands more will die.

California endured mudslides, snow, and flash floods this week. Home in #CA48, my constituents underwent mandatory evacuations. Climate change has arrived in full force, and we can't afford to delay action any longer, much less condone denial altogether.
Hope to hear from you at my first Town Hall on Tuesday! RSVP here:  https://goo.gl/forms/p2btxsSOtyHNwKcq1 … https://www.latimes.com/socal/daily-pilot/news/tn-dpt-me-around-town-20190214-story.html …

Tomorrow, @alisoviejocity is partnering with @YWCANOC to offer free mammogram screenings to qualified low-income women 40+ older without medical insurance in front of the Iglesia Park Community Center at 24671 Via Iglesia. Don't hesitate to get checked--it could save your life.

My friend, @RepGaramendi and I went on KCAL last night. A fictional national emergency would set a dangerous precedent for future presidents. Trump could use the declaration to raid billions from California's disaster relief funds- which Californians need for real emergencies. pic.twitter.com/tZdn5CiSpK

.@RepGaramendi and I will be on KCAL and CBS tonight to address the threat Trump’s national emergency would pose to California.

While we’re fighting fires and extreme weather, he would take billions from California’s disaster relief funds to pay for this monument to his ego.

The brinkmanship of the last two months is emblematic of the brokenness of our politics. It is time for us to walk away from shutdowns and emergency declarations, and work together in good faith to improve the lives of the people who sent us here

He would unlawfully steal money from Army Corps of Engineers projects, including $160 mil in CA-48, to fund a monument to his ego. When we face real emergencies like climate change & the opioid crisis, it defies belief that he would so casually waste taxpayers’ money. https://twitter.com/RepHarley/status/1096157062969638912 …

If he does indeed intend to declare a national emergency, President Trump will set a dangerous precedent for future presidents, Democrat or Republican, to abuse their authority to circumvent the checks and balances of the Constitution.

I know there are Republicans who care about the Climate Crisis as much as I do. I'm focused on finding bipartisan support here in Congress and working across the aisle. So let's work together. https://video.foxnews.com/v/6002280339001/#sp=show-clips …
As a coastal community, #CA48 relies on the Coast Guard to keep us safe, and I’m proud to hang their seal in my office. pic.twitter.com/MaeJ7tvlma
Tune in at 1:30! https://twitter.com/OutnumberedOT/status/1096101777135542278 …

It's been one year since 17 students and staff in Parkland, Florida were shot and killed. The survivors have been fighting every day since for action from this House- let's show our commitment to them by getting to work, & not stopping until children stop dying from gun violence. https://twitter.com/HouseJudiciary/status/1095853420697866245 …

CA Community Colleges are powerful engines of social mobility. I met with the Coast Community College District to discuss how Congress can ease the burden on student borrowers, improve our aid system, & empower our community colleges to open doors of opportunity for Californians. pic.twitter.com/qyN9qFL5xg

CA48 is joining the Congressional Art Competition for the first year ever! This is a wonderful opportunity to celebrate local young creative talent. If your school wants to participate, please call or email our office. See more here:  https://www.house.gov/sites/default/files/uploads/documents/2019-Rules-for-Students-and-Teachers.pdf … pic.twitter.com/vjhVX4R394

If we want to talk about national emergencies we should be talking about the opioid crisis, the gun violence crisis, and climate change--which Orange County residents have to deal with every day. These are true national crises that need our attention. https://twitter.com/AmericaNewsroom/status/1095728261093642240 …
On @foxnews in 10! pic.twitter.com/MBqu1tVh6G
I’ll be talking with @SandraSmithFox on @FoxNews at 8:40am PT/11:40 ET. Hope you’ll tune in!

This morning I spoke with federal employees at @AFGENational. The only federal employees who should lose their paychecks in a shutdown are in Congress, the Cabinet, and White House. It’s time we stop talking about shutdowns and start talking about strengthening the middle class. pic.twitter.com/3G80ZvvDCG

Today I met with @MFOLDC and @Team_Enough. The anniversary of the Parkland shooting is two days away– and nearly 1200 kids have died from gun violence in a year of Congressional inaction. It's past time to pass H.R. 8 and expand background checks, and that’s just the first step. https://twitter.com/Team_Enough/status/1095350542778449921 …

The Dept of Interior wants to drill everywhere and ignore environmental consequences, including off the OC Coast. I'm cosponsoring @RepHuffman and @RepBrianFitz's bill to keep drilling out of the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge. This administration needs a reality check. pic.twitter.com/9alaXmLvcl

I just wrapped up a meeting with @TSA workers who are deeply concerned about the the looming possibility of another damaging shutdown. Federal employees can’t afford another manufactured crisis at their expense. It’s time for the President to get serious and work with us.
Happy birthday to the @NAACP! Those of us in Congress can do justice to the organization's legacy by seeking out justice in the work we do here.

Our office is participating in the @LibraryCongress Surplus Books Program! Every month, the Library will send surplus books to non-profits in need in #CA48. Spread the word or apply here:  https://www.loc.gov/acq/Surplus_Books_Application.pdf …

I'm proud to co-sponsor bipartisan legislation reaffirming congressional support for the Paris climate agreement. #ClimateChange is a global crisis, and we are #StillIn. We can't afford to abandon our obligations to the global community and future generations. https://twitter.com/RepHuffman/status/1093966162529013762 …

Just sent out our first newsletter - in my first month in office, we've cosponsored 40 bills, met with 150 constituent groups, and responded to 1000 constituent letters. Keep up with us by subscribing here!: 

 https://rouda.house.gov/contact/newsletter?time=15499106174380.07551603532637063 … pic.twitter.com/lnfLvmwTKK

When you cut through the noise of Washington politics, the title of this job is "Representative." I'm excited to see my constituents and hear from you face to face in my first Town Hall next Tuesday! Join us by RSVPing here: https://goo.gl/forms/fcNqeHPJCE5FGldf1 …

They took a swing at California too–– #CA48 shouldn't be taxed twice on the same dollar. I'm proud to be an original cosponsor of the bipartisan SALT Act. https://twitter.com/BillPascrell/status/1094997564838031361 …

The Post's report confirms that the EPA has abandoned its watch under the Trump Admin. Congress won’t let this administration sell out the future of humankind to fossil fuel interests. We will be taking action to fight the Climate Crisis, and the EPA will be held to account. https://twitter.com/brady_dennis/status/1093975194488717312 …

At the @TransportDems hearing yesterday, I talked about the intersection between infrastructure and climate change. The climate crisis is the greatest threat to humankind, and green infrastructure is an opportunity to #ActOnClimate and modernize our economy. pic.twitter.com/MhRJv5bYYg

I cosponsored the Veterans’ Access to Child Care Act, which passed today with bipartisan support. #ChildCare4Vets is just common sense--it expands childcare services during appointments at the VA. Veterans shouldn’t have to choose between healthcare and taking care of their kids. https://twitter.com/RepBrownley/status/1093911655342395392 …

This transportation and infrastructure hearing is (refreshingly) light on partisanship and bluster. It's clear basically everyone here is dead serious about understanding this issue, and getting to work on an infrastructure package.
Let's get it done. pic.twitter.com/0J2scejMCM
This administration has had, at best, an awkward relationship with ethics. We must pass H.R. 1 to ensure that public servants can’t use their offices to enrich themselves. pic.twitter.com/yPkYDsruz3

This morning I rose in response to the #SOTU “We should not wait for, nor expect, the president to lead an agenda for the people. But we can move forward...and work with one another, regardless of party, to improve the lives of the people who trusted us to represent them” pic.twitter.com/QUKuc6Jx2X

Cleaning up our democracy is the first step to cleaning up our environment. If oil & gas interests have Washington in a vice grip, Congress can’t fight climate change. I support H.R.1, and look forward to today’s @OversightDems hearing on executive branch ethics. #ActOnClimate
Also had a chance to chat with @nbcla about #SOTU and calling on the President to support bipartisan infrastructure and immigration solutions pic.twitter.com/X61ZjFw9Sx
Always a pleasure to sit down with my friend @DeanObeidallah! https://twitter.com/DeanObeidallah/status/1092903496230277121 …
Catch me on @ABC7 tonight in advance of the State of the Union. pic.twitter.com/cnoyrhfXjb

As we prepare for the State of the Union tonight, there is one issue we know the president will fail to address: the looming climate crisis. Seal Beach, and all of Orange County need action instead of denial from the EPA. https://www.ocregister.com/2019/02/04/after-storms-seal-beach-looks-like-a-landfill-blanketed-with-trash/ …
Excited to get to work with @TransportDems! https://twitter.com/TiffanyStecker/status/1092822937642680320 …

I’m proud to join the Vietnamese-Americans of Orange County as they celebrate Tết, and welcome the Year of the Pig. The contributions of Vietnamese heritage have enriched our whole community. In the spirit of the new year, I wish our community prosperity and good fortune. pic.twitter.com/lDiXnSGUaf

ICYMI, I chatted with @conanNBCLA Sunday Morning about the opportunities this Congress has to pass real bipartisan legislation to develop OC’s infrastructure and economy, including my own bill, the Encouraging Small Business Innovation Act. pic.twitter.com/mPedInqQXl

For 28 days in February, we honor the contributions made by African-Americans to this country. Black History is American History, and these stories and contributions are foundational to our values and culture. #BlackHistoryMonth pic.twitter.com/8BXXo0XmuT

Orange County folks: stay safe during the storm tonight and this weekend, there’s a flood warning. Stay away from downed power lines--if you need sandbags, the Orange County Fire Authority stations are providing them for free. Kaira, the pups, and I will be staying in tonight. pic.twitter.com/xfUDaxCDtO
Honored to celebrate Tết with my friend @tamnguyenabc, and bring in the New Year with my Vietnamese-American constituents. pic.twitter.com/yXLLmOgigB

My next stop was @PPOSBC’s newest health center in Costa Mesa. No other healthcare provider has to shoulder political motivated attacks at their literal doorstep, but they continue to provide essential healthcare for women. I’m proud to stand with Planned Parenthood in Congress. pic.twitter.com/4mnrxKgCuN
Excited to work with this great group on economic development opportunities in OC! https://twitter.com/OCBC_GA/status/1091416979066376193 …

Yesterday afternoon I had an opportunity to tour Jamboree Housing's affordable housing communities serving #CA48 today. The service they provide OC seniors, veterans, and the recently homeless is indispensable and a model for alleviating the housing crisis throughout the state. pic.twitter.com/in1HGKY4Os
